channel.title: R on James H. Wade
channel.description: Recent content in R on James H. Wade

item.title: Tidy Tuesday 2019-50
item.description: Here is my entry for #TidyTuesday from 2019-50: ‘You can make it in R.’ Import the Data library(tidyverse) library(gganimate) library(waffle) d <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2019, week = 50) diseases <- d$diseases murders <- d$international_murders guns <- d$gun_murders regents <- d$nyc_regents Part 1: Diseases The first plot was inspired by an interactive graphic from WSJ. The data for these visuals comes from the Tycho Project. To start, let’s add a column that provides a rate of disease incidence.

item.title: Tidy Tuesday 2019-49
item.description: Here is my entry for #TidyTuesday from 2019-49: Philadelphia Parking Tickets. Importing and Cleaning the Data The data for this week comes from Open Data Philly. I’ll use tidytuesdayR library to import the data. library(tidyverse) d <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2019, week = 49)[[1]] glimpse(d) ## Observations: 1,260,891 ## Variables: 7 ## $ violation_desc <chr> "BUS ONLY ZONE", "STOPPING PROHIBITED", "OVER TIME LIM… ## $ issue_datetime <dttm> 2017-12-06 12:29:00, 2017-10-16 18:03:00, 2017-11-02 … ## $ fine <dbl> 51, 51, 26, 26, 76, 51, 36, 36, 76, 26, 26, 301, 36, 5… ## $ issuing_agency <chr> "PPA", "PPA", "PPA", "PPA", "PPA", "POLICE", "PPA", "P… ## $ lat <dbl> 40.
